info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 2:48PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF UNCOMPAHGRE PLATEAU/DALLAS DIVIDE AND GRAND VALLEY COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 247 PM MST, a snow squall was near Fruita, or 8 miles west of Grand Junction moving northeast at 20 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Fruita around 305 PM MST. Grand Junction around 310 PM MST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 20 and 33. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 34. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
